snippet: More than 8,000 schools were reopening, although attendance at many was poor amid some skepticism that the crisis was over.
abstract: More than 8,000 schools in Sierra Leone reopen after being closed for nine months due to the Ebola epidemic.
lead_paragraph: More than 8,000 schools were reopening, although attendance at many was poor amid some skepticism that the crisis was over.

headline.main: Sierra Leone: Schools Reopen as Ebola Outbreak Subsides
headline.print_headline: Africa; Sierra Leone: Schools Reopen as Ebola Outbreak Subsides
